message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This analysis uses both the Global Findex database on financial inclusion and the UNDP's Human Development Index to examine the relationship between access to financial services and human development outcomes.", "dataset": ["Global Findex", "UNDP's Human Development Index"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) to investigate the factors associated with child stunting in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS)"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "This paper draws on the World Bank's Enterprise Survey data, which includes information on more than 130,000 firms across 139 countries, to assess the impact of firm-level corruption on export competitiveness.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Survey"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Corruption"]}, {"sentence": "We use panel data from the Living Standards Measurement Study - Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA), covering six African countries, to examine the effectiveness of agricultural extension programs in improving smallholder farmers' access to agricultural inputs and knowledge.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study - Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "To analyze the relationship between air pollution and respiratory health outcomes, we use the Global Burden of Disease (GBD) datasets, which provide estimates of air pollution exposure and morbidity and mortality due to respiratory diseases in different parts of the world.", "dataset": ["Global Burden of Disease (GBD)"], "topic": ["Environment", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the International Debt Statistics database to investigate the relationship between external debt and economic growth in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["International Debt Statistics"], "topic": ["Debt", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the World Values Survey and the European Social Survey to explore the relationship between social trust, income inequality, and subjective well-being.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "European Social Survey"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the determinants of household energy use patterns, we use a dataset on household energy consumption collected by the Energy Information Administration (EIA) alongside demographic and socio-economic data from the American Community Survey (ACS).", "dataset": ["Energy Information Administration (EIA)", "American Community Survey (ACS)"], "topic": ["Energy", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We use panel data on firms' innovation activities and performance from the World Bank's Doing Business database and the Innovation Follow-up Survey to investigate the relationship between product and process innovation and firm productivity in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Doing Business database", "Innovation Follow-up Survey"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Health Organization's Global Observatory for eHealth and the OECD's Better Life Index, we compare the extent of digital health innovation and adoption across different regions of the world.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization's Global Observatory for eHealth", "OECD's Better Life Index"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Health"]}]
